question: 虫
userExplanation: more general than the English words. It covers things like worms and spiders, too, so in that sense it's more like <vocabulary>creepy-crawly</vocabulary>.
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well. This word is actually more general than the English words <vocabulary>insect</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>bug</vocabulary>, though. It covers things like worms and spiders, too, so in that sense it's more like <vocabulary>creepy-crawly</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it should use the kun'yomi reading, which is also the reading you learned when you learned this kanji!
